intro: Podostemum munnarense, commonly known as the Munnar podostemum, is a rare aquatic plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and unique reproductive structures adapted to aquatic environments. The plant typically grows in shallow, fast-flowing streams and rocky substrates. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Podostemum munnarense plays a vital role in its ecosystem by providing habitat for aquatic invertebrates and contributing to the biodiversity of freshwater habitats.
